title: Finding organics on Mars means absolutely nothing for life
snippet: The red planet, Mars, may once have been teeming with life, just as Earth is today. Finding "organics" on Mars, however, doesn't mean life.

title: These Ants Found a Loophole for a Fundamental Rule of Life

title: Ancient Asteroid Ripped Apart In Collision Had Flowing Water
snippet: The parent world of asteroid Ryugu, the space rock visited by the Japanese mission Hayabusa2, had flowing water for over a billion years.

title: The Climate Change Paradox
snippet: Earth's climate is chaotic and volatile. Climate change is simple and predictable. How can both be true?
